pageProps.content:
![Uiamho Lake Skywalk (의암호 스카이워크)](/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605228_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Uiamho Lake Skywalk, one of the two largest skywalks in Chuncheon along with Soyanggang Skywalk, is located on Uiamho Bike Path between Kim Youjeong Memorial Stone and Chuncheon Songam Sports Town in the Uiam Lakeside. Connecting with the water bridge section of the bike path, Uiamho Lake Skywalk consists of a 10 m-long straight section and a 10 m-diameter circular section, located 12 m above the water. The entire floor is made of transparent glass, so visitors will feel like walking on the water. When you stand on the skywalk, you will encounter a picturesque view of Samaksan Mountain and Uiamho Lake. Soyanggang Skywalk boasts another splendid scenery of Chuncheon. Although the access from the Kim Youjeong Memorial Stone is close to Uiam Lake Skywalk, parking space is insufficient, thus, it is recommended to use the public parking lot near Chuncheon Songam Sports Town. It takes 15 min by foot or bike along the Uiamho Bike Path from the public parking lot to Uiam Lake Skywalk. It is a great place for a stroll amid the magnificent landscape. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|• 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
• For more info: +82-33-250-3089| |opendate:|June 14, 2014| |parking:|Not allowed(Parking lot of Uiam Ice Rink inside Songam Sports Town)| |restdate:|January, February, and December| |usetime:|09:00–18:00| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Parking Fees:|Free of charge| |Admission Fees:|Free of charge| |Restrooms:|None| |Available Facilities:|Skywalk above water| ## Detail Image ![/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605230_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605230_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605231_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605231_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605232_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605232_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605233_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605233_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605234_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605234_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605229_image2_1.webp](/2022-10-16-1665906295356/2605229_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [☎️+82-33-250-3089](tel:+82332503089) ```googleMap latitude: 37.8471622126 longitude: 127.6799656772 title: 468-1, Chiljeon-dong, Chuncheon-si, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Subway/Train]
Chuncheon Station (Gyeongchun Line), Exit 1.

[Taxi]
Approx. 15 min from Chuncheon Station.

data.title: Uiamho Lake Skywalk (의암호 스카이워크)
data.description: Uiamho Lake Skywalk, one of the two largest skywalks in Chuncheon along with Soyanggang Skywalk, is located on Uiamho Bike Path between Kim Youjeong Memorial Stone and Chuncheon Songam Sports Town in the Uiam Lakeside. Connecting with the water bridge section of the bike path, Uiamho Lake Skywalk consists of a 10 m-long straight section and a 10 m-diameter circular section, located 12 m above the water. The entire floor is made of transparent glass, so visitors will feel like walking on the water. When you stand on the skywalk, you will encounter a picturesque view of Samaksan Mountain and Uiamho Lake. Soyanggang Skywalk boasts another splendid scenery of Chuncheon. Although the access from the Kim Youjeong Memorial Stone is close to Uiam Lake Skywalk, parking space is insufficient, thus, it is recommended to use the public parking lot near Chuncheon Songam Sports Town. It takes 15 min by foot or bike along the Uiamho Bike Path from the public parking lot to Uiam Lake Skywalk. It is a great place for a stroll amid the magnificent landscape.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gongjicheon Recreation Area (공지천유원지)
dataList.description: The area of Gongjicheon Stream connected to the Bukhangang River is a shelter in the middle of Chuncheon City. This recreation area comprises various facilities along both sides of the Gongjicheon Stream, including Gongjicheon Sculpture Park, Uiam Park, Memorial Hall for Ethiopian Veterans in the Korean War, inline skating rink, outdoor stage, and fountain. Visitors can cross the water easily through the Gongjicheon Bridge and the lower pedestrian bridge. The waterside trail and the bike path are popular among citizens with the seasonal scenic view. In particular, cherry blossom attracts many visitors in spring. There is a bicycle rental stand nearby the stream. It is recommended to enjoy biking around the Gongjicheon Stream or along the Uiamho Bike Path. Another interesting ride is a pedal boat with which visitors can create a romantic memory with a splendid scenery of the Gongjicheon Stream.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gangneung Coffee Street (강릉커피거리)
dataList.description: Gangneung in Gangwon-do is the first local district in Korea to host a coffee festival and support coffee artisans as well as promote development of coffee related facilities and contents such as a coffee museum, coffee street, coffee factory, barista academy, and more. With almost all coffee shops in the area roasting their own coffee beans, Gangneung is well-recognized as the city of coffee.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gangmun Beach (강문해변)
dataList.description: Located in Gangmun-dong, Gangmun Beach is lined with fresh hoe (sliced raw fish) restaurants along Gangmunhang Port. The beach has accommodations nearby and is in close proximity to the Gyeongpo area, making it a great vacation destination. Not only is the beach a well-known diving spot among scuba divers for its deep waters and abundant marine life, but its dock is also popular among fishers all year round.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Daegwallyeong Samyang Farm (대관령 삼양목장)
dataList.description: Daegwallyeong Samyang Farm is a livestock farm opened in 1972 to source product for Samyang Food, then opened as a tourist attraction in 2007 making it open to the public. The animals are free to roam the large ranch fields and the wind generator on top of the hill is the largest in Korea to create natural energy. At the farm, visitors can take in the beautiful scenery, watch a sheep herding performance, feed sheep and ostrich, and so much more. There are various Samyang products sold at the ranch mart as well as organic milk products to try as well.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Chuncheon Oksanga - Okgwangsan Jade Mine (춘천 옥산가 (옥광산))
dataList.description: This tourist destination was established as a healing and experience attraction based on Korea’s only jade mine in Chuncheon. It comprises Jade Cave Experience Center, Jade Mine Sauna, Toy Museum, Bakery Cafe, restaurant, and other facilities. In particular, Jade Cave Experience Center, which was built by using an actual jade pit, invites visitors to observe and touch rough gemstones. The center has a shelter surrounded by jade stones and an earthenware museum, which exhibits various types of earthenware. If you want to have a healing experience with jade’s energy, the jade sauna is an ideal place to visit. The sauna was built with high-quality nephrite from the jade mine and uses mineral water produced from deep in the jade pit. Moon Valley consisting of a gallery, modern history museum, and toy museum is popular among family visitors with children, and kidults too. The toy museum is full of famous character figures from animated films and popular movies, such as Taekwon V, Mazinger Z, Disney characters, and Star Wars characters. The outdoor park behind the Moon Valley has a small zoo and a walking path.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Chuncheon Mulgil-ro (춘천물레길)
dataList.description: The Mullegil Trail is designed to guide tourists to enjoy the beautiful scenery along the waterway in Chuncheon, a lake city. The Mullegil Trail also offers tourists an opportunity to travel around Chuncheon’s lake and river by canoe. With basic instructions, people of all ages can go canoeing easily. Many companies provide diverse canoeing courses, and their common course starts from the Chuncheon Songam Sports Town, continues to canoe toward the Uiamho Lake Skywalk, and returns. Tourists can enjoy canoeing along the Chuncheon Mullegil Trail and use the King Canoe Quay, which is equipped with a facility for the vulnerable people on tourism. Selected as an open tourist attraction, the King Canoe Quay provides canoeing programs for people in wheelchairs and the visually impaired.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Chuncheon Cheongpyeongsa Temple (청평사 (춘천))
dataList.description: Cheongpyeongsa Temple is a Buddhist temple with 1,000 years of tradition, located at Obongsan Mountain. Originally established as Baegamseonwon Temple in 973, the temple changed its name several times, went through construction works, and has become the current Cheongpyeongsa Temple. Yi Ja-hyeon, a scholar of the Goryeo period, built a garden here by keeping its natural topography after he left his government post. In this area, there is a pond that was built during the Goryeo period and has preserved its original form. Many cultural heritages have disappeared over the years and during the Korean War as well. The remaining cultural heritages include Hoejeonmun Gate of Cheongpyeongsa Temple (Treasure No. 164), Three-story Stone Pagoda of Cheongpyeongsa Temple (Gangwon-do Cultural Heritage Material No. 8), and Stupa of Yi Ja-hyeon (posthumous epithet  Jillakgong). Cheongpyeongsa Temple’s Hoejeonmun Gate was built instead of Sacheonwangmun Gate (the gate of the Four Guardian Kings), in order to enlighten people about the transmigration of souls. Cheongpyeongsa Temple bears a myth about a princess and a serpent. The princess suffered a lot from a serpent as she couldn’t get rid of it from her body. Then she came to Cheongpyeongsa Temple and prayed to the Buddha, and she became free from the serpent. Therefore, the Three-story Stone Pagoda of Cheongpyeongsa Temple is also called “Princess Pagoda.” Although the scale of the temple is not large, it is known for beautiful natural landscape harmonized with artificial structures, such as a pavilion and a pond. Accordingly, the area of the temple was designated as Scenic Site No. 70. Cheongpyeongsa Temple can be also reached by taking a ferry at the Soyanggang Dam Quay.
dataList.author: korea-tour
